definitions.definition: used to emphasize that a particular statement, feeling, etc. is sincere or real

examples.text: She **truly believes** that none of this is her fault.
I'm truly sorry that things had to end like this.
I do care. Truly, I do!
He could never truly forgive her.
He truly wants to improve the town.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize a particular quality

examples.text: a truly great work of art

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that a particular description is accurate or correct

examples.text: a truly democratic system of government
Well, **really and truly**, things were better than expected.
He started the first truly international ballet company.
They truly understand what we're going through.
a brand that is truly global
By that time we were well and truly lost.

definitions.definition: used at the end of a formal letter before you sign your name

examples.text: Steve came first, Robin second, and yours truly came last.
